author: Beatriz Pérez
title: La provisió del fàrmac del TDAH es normalitzarà el 2025
text:
La provisió del fàrmac del TDAH es normalitzarà el 2025
La distribució baixa un 12,6% a Espanya a causa de l’augment de la demanda global i la falta de capacitat dels laboratoris per fer-li front.
El medicament Concerta (que té com a principi actiu el metilfenidat), destinat al trastorn per dèficit d’atenció i hiperactivitat (TDAH), ha patit una reducció del subministrament d’un 12,6% a Espanya durant el 2024. El laboratori que el comercialitza, Janssen-Cillad, té més d’un 80% de la quota de mercat i l’escassetat es deu a un augment de la demanda a escala global i la falta de capacitat per fer-li front. Com a conseqüència, altres laboratoris titulars d’aquest tipus de medicaments (hi ha altres fàrmacs per al TDAH basats en un altre principi actiu: l’atomoxetina) també han experimentat escassetat. Així ho va dir ahir l’Agència Espanyola de Medicaments i Productes Sanitaris (Aemps) en una nota de premsa.
Segons l’Aemps, Janssen-Cilag i Liconsa, les farmacèutiques de Concerta i Atenza respectivament (els dos fàrmacs basats en el metilfenidat), han confirmat ja la disponibilitat d’un nombre més elevat d’unitats per al 2025 per garantir el restabliment del subministrament amb normalitat. En concret, Liconsa ha reorganitzat la seva planificació en aquests últims dos mesos per poder augmentar el subministrament en un 721%, i per al 2025 té planificat duplicar la producció de metilfenidat a la seva planta a Guadalajara, segons va informar l’Aemps, que va mantenir reunions amb societats científiques, i associacions mèdiques i de pacients. L’organisme també va precisar que hi ha encara unitats disponibles com a medicament estranger en els punts de dispensació de les comunitats autònomes.
Com explica Beatriz Salazar, del grup de treball de Farmàcia Neuropsiquiàtrica de la Societat Espanyola de Farmàcia Hospitalària (SEFH), el Concerta és un dels tractaments estimulants per tractar el TDAH. N’hi ha d’altres com, per exemple, l’Elvanse. I després hi ha un altre tipus de fàrmacs que no són estimulants (i que també estan experimentant escassetat de subministrament). "El Concerta no és l’única especialitat de metilfenidat, i tots tenen problemes de subministrament a Espanya. Com a alternatives n’hi ha d’altres, però el problema és que l’Elvanse no està finançat com a primera opció. I els tractaments no estimulants són menys eficaços; es donen als infants quan no toleren bé el metilfenidat", assenyala Salazar.
Poques alternatives
Així, les alternatives per als pacients amb TDAH són "poques", com reconeix aquesta farmacèutica. "Tot i que sí que és cert que la més gran de les especialitats de metilfenidat estan amb problemes de subministrament, alguns sí que tenen disponibilitat. Però la gent quan arriba a la farmàcia en fa provisió. A Espanya hi ha una batalla entre pares per trobar aquest tractament i, quan el troben, se n’emporten tot el que poden", afegeix Salazar, que creu que el Ministeri de Sanitat hauria "de garantir" la disponibilitat d’aquest medicament.
Darrere d’aquesta escassetat de subministrament hi ha diversos motius, però un d’aquests és el preu. "A Espanya el preu és cinc vegades inferior que el que paguen a França o Alemanya. I, quan hi ha problemes de subministrament, el laboratori prioritza la venda en països on el preu és més elevat. Però si l’Estat marca un preu, l’Aemps ha de posar uns requisits de subministrament", insisteix.
-

author: PA News Agency
title: Venezuela to hold military exercises as British warship heads to Guyana | South Wales Argus
text: President Nicolas Maduro has ordered Venezuela’s armed forces to conduct defensive exercises in the Eastern Caribbean after the UK sent a warship towards Guyana’s territorial waters as the South American neighbours dispute a large border region. In a nationally televised address on Thursday, Mr Maduro said 6,000 Venezuelan troops, including air and naval forces, will conduct joint operations off the nation’s eastern coast — near the border with Guyana. Mr Maduro described the impending arrival of British ship HMS Trent to Guyana’s shores as a “threat” to his country. He argued the ship’s deployment violates a recent agreement between the South American nations. “We believe in diplomacy, in dialogue and in peace, but no one is going to threaten Venezuela,” Mr Maduro said in a room where he was accompanied by a dozen military commanders. “This is an unacceptable threat to any sovereign country in Latin America.” Venezuela and Guyana are involved in a border dispute over the Essequibo, a sparsely populated region the size of Florida with vast oil deposits off its shores. The region has been under Guyana’s control for decades. But in December, Venezuela relaunched its historical claim to the Essequibo through a referendum in which it asked voters in the country whether the Essequibo should be turned into a Venezuelan state. As tensions over the region escalated, the leaders of both countries met in the Caribbean island of St Vincent and signed an agreement which said they would solve their dispute through nonviolent means. During the talks, however, Guyana’s President Irfan Ali said his nation reserved its right to work with its partners to ensure the defence of his country. On Thursday, Guyanese officials described the visit of HMS Trent as a planned activity aimed at improving the nation’s defence capabilities and said the ship’s visit will continue as scheduled. “Nothing that we do or have done is threatening Venezuela,” Guyana’s vice-president Bharrat Jagdeo told reporters in Georgetown, the nation’s capital. HMS Trent is a patrol and rescue ship that was recently used to intercept drug traffickers off the West Coast of Africa. It can accommodate up to 30 sailors and a contingent of 18 marines and is equipped with 30mm cannons and a landing pad for helicopters and drones. The ship had been sent to Barbados in early December to intercept drug traffickers, but its mission was changed on December 24, when it was sent to Guyana. Authorities did not specify when it was expected to arrive off Guyana’s shores. The UK’s Ministry of Defence said the ship would be conducting joint operations with Guyana’s defence forces. The nation of 800,000 people has a small military that is made up of 3,000 soldiers, 200 sailors and four small patrol boats known as Barracudas. author: Sandra Kent
title: I think my ‘great boyfriend’ might be married
text: Q. I have a great boyfriend I love very much. We work together — he’s an executive — and even though we aren’t supposed to be dating, the attraction was just too strong. We have been working together for four months and dating for three. He is such a great guy; I can see myself with him forever. However, today, when he walked into work, I noticed he was wearing a wedding ring. He had an early Zoom meeting and went directly into his office. When the meeting was over and he came out, we chatted for a while, and I noticed he was no longer wearing the ring. He just told me he loved me last night! Is there any other explanation other than he is married? I can’t think of one. What is good ex-etiquette? A. Unfortunately, I can’t think of one, either. And the fact that he removed the ring before he spoke to you speaks volumes. So many red flags. You may be too in love right now to see them. First one, this is calculated, and he is fully aware that he is betraying not just one woman, but two. Consider his character. Second red flag, he is your superior at work. There are reasons why this kind of relationship may be forbidden at your place of employment. The power imbalance can raise concerns about coercion, such as pressure to stay in the relationship to keep one’s job. He also knew this all while “the attraction was so strong.” He is obviously not the man you thought he was. There is actually one ex-etiquette rule to consider for situations like this, rule No. 8. Good Ex-etiquette Rule No. 8 reminds us to be honest and straightforward in all our interactions. That means, even if your boyfriend isn’t being honest, that doesn’t mean you can’t be. So as much as you love this guy and you want to have a future with him, know that there is no future with someone who is so deceptive. Pick yourself up, dust yourself off, and start all over again. That’s good ex-etiquette. Dr. Jann Blackstone is a child custody mediator and the author of “The Bonus Family Handbook: The Definitive Guide to Co-parenting and Creating Stronger Families.”/Tribune News Service

author: FOX 8 Staff
title: 1 of 2 missing children found dead after mother ‘brutally’ slain; suspect arrested
text:
LORANGER, La. ( WVUE /Gray News) - Authorities in Louisiana are searching say one of two missing children has been found dead while the other was found alive and well.
The Tangipahoa Parish Sheriff’s Office reported the recovery of 4-year-old Erin Brunett’s body Thursday afternoon. Her 6-year-old sister, Jalie Brunett, was found alive and well. The suspect was arrested in Jackson, Mississippi.
The Louisiana State Police issued an Amber Alert for the two children after finding their mother dead early Thursday morning.
According to the Tangipahoa Parish Sheriff’s Office, 35-year-old Callie Brunett was missing for over 24 hours before being found found “brutally” slain in her home on North Cooper Road. Her death is being investigated as a homicide.
Her two small children, 6-year-old Jalie and 3-year-old Erin were “unaccounted for,” Sheriff Daniel Edwards said.
An AMBER Alert was issued at 12:28 p.m. on Thursday for Jalie and Erin Brunett, who were unaccounted for after their mother, 35-year-old Callie Brunett, was found "brutally murdered" in her Loranger home. (LSP) Edwards said Brunett was reported missing Tuesday and because her car was not at her house, her family did not believe she was home. Thursday morning, her father made entry into her home and discovered her body and her children missing.
The manner of Brunett’s death was not disclosed, but Edwards said there was “blood everywhere.”
Copyright 2024 WVUE via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: Diario da Manhã
title: Chuvas aumentam risco nas estradas e PRF emite alerta aos motoristas - Diário da Manhã
text: A chegada das primeiras chuvas após um longo período de estiagem eleva o [risco de deslizamentos](https://www.dm.com.br/cotidiano/moradores-sao-resgatados-de-alagamento-apos-chuvas-151138) e torna as pistas mais escorregadias nas rodovias federais. Diante dessa situação, a [Polícia Rodoviária Federal](https://www.dm.com.br/policia/homem-e-preso-com-mais-de-meia-tonelada-de-drogas-no-carro-151179) (PRF) emitiu um alerta para motoristas, destacando a necessidade de redobrar a atenção ao dirigir. A PRF destaca que os cuidados devem começar antes mesmo de entrar na estrada. Verificar o estado e a calibragem dos pneus é essencial para garantir uma boa aderência e evitar a aquaplanagem, que ocorre quando os pneus perdem contato com o asfalto devido ao acúmulo de água, podendo levar à perda de controle do veículo. Além disso, é importante checar o funcionamento dos limpadores de para-brisa, faróis e lanternas. Para garantir a segurança de motoristas e passageiros durante os dias chuvosos, a PRF recomenda as seguintes orientações: Reduza a Velocidade: Mantenha uma velocidade compatível com as condições da pista. Aumente a Distância: Mantenha uma distância segura do veículo à frente para evitar colisões. Evite Frenagens Bruscas: Acelere e freie suavemente para manter o controle do veículo. Use Faróis: Utilize os faróis baixos para aumentar a visibilidade. Esteja Atento a Sinais: Fique atento a placas e sinais de alerta nas rodovias.

author: Benzinga
title: Optimism Is Akin To A Race Car 'Revving At The Starting Line,' Bullish Analyst Says By Benzinga
text:
© Reuters. Optimism Is Akin To A Race Car 'Revving At The Starting Line,' Bullish Analyst Says Benzinga - by Murtuza Merchant, Benzinga Staff Writer.
A close observer of Optimism (CRYPTO: OP) expects that the digital asset is "very likely going much higher."
This prediction follows OP's recent all-time high in otherwise volatile market conditions, which saw Bitcoin 's (CRYPTO: BTC) price dip to $41,800.
In a series of social media posts, the analyst — who goes by the handle The Flow Horse — likened Optimism's recent price action to a race car "still revving at the start line."
The token enjoyed a successful retest and reclaim of its yearly high of $3.45, aligning with similar past performances across the market.
"Just look across the entire market and see what has followed with each pair that has done this," Flow Horse stated, urging investors to give Optimism "room to breathe" and anticipate further upward movement.
However, The Flow Horse acknowledged the influence of Bitcoin's stability on overall market sentiment.
He also expressed optimism for Mina Protocol (CRYPTO: MINA), a privacy-focused blockchain aiming for a lightweight footprint, suggesting it could see significant growth "if BTC stabilizes."
Also Read: PancakeSwap Slashes Supply By 300M, Will Token Prices Rise Like Hotcakes?
Mina's resilience, remaining in the green and hovering near record highs despite the market dip, further solidified his confidence.
The analyst was also tentatively optimistic about Bitcoin itself, but noted the recent increase in funding rates indicated a potential leverage-fueled price manipulation.
Prior instances of altcoins rallying in response to Bitcoin's decline are "not a good look," according to the analyst.
Overall, The Flow Horse's analysis highlighted Optimism's potential for significant gains, while urging investors to remain mindful of Bitcoin's influence and potential market instability.
His focus on the Mina Protocol suggests an additional avenue for potential growth amidst the current market uncertainty.
Read Next: Crypto Hedge Funds Rise From The Ashes: 3 Industry Leaders Touting Significant Gains
Image: Pixabay
© 2023 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.

author: Kalin Ned
title: On-Demand AI Nutritionists - January AI Has Introduced Jan to Revolutionize Dietary Guidance (TrendHunter.com)
text:
January AI's Jan is an on-demand AI nutritionist designed to optimize blood sugar and metabolic health through personalized, real-time dietary guidance. Unlike traditional calorie-counting apps, Jan uses AI-powered food recognition to analyze meals via photos or descriptions and provide instant nutritional insights and glucose impact predictions. The on-demand AI nutritionist shifts focus from passive logging to active metabolic optimization to help users make informed dietary decisions.
January AI's Jan offers a hyper-personalized experience by setting weekly nutrition goals based on macronutrient balance and individual health objectives. Users receive daily guidance, real-time insights, and weekly check-ins to track progress and refine goals. Jan also integrates with Apple Health to provide a comprehensive metabolic health overview, including activity and sleep data.
Image Credit: January AI
January AI Has Introduced Jan to Revolutionize Dietary Guidance

3. Real-time Dietary Insights - Instant nutritional feedback is becoming pivotal, allowing for immediate dietary adjustments and improved health outcomes.
4. On-demand Health Services - The rise of on-demand services in health technology is offering consumers immediate access to expert knowledge and personalized solutions.
Industry Implications
1. Healthcare Technology - Innovations in digital health solutions are accelerating the integration of AI to deliver personalized, real-time health insights directly to consumers.
2. Food and Nutrition Apps - The evolution of food apps is being propelled by AI, shifting from simple calorie counting to comprehensive nutritional and metabolic guidance.
3. Wearable Health Tech - Incorporating AI-driven nutritional insights into wearable devices is expanding the scope of real-time health monitoring and personalized feedback.

author: @AKNewsNow
title: Former refugee helps hundreds of Ukrainians to safety in Alaska
text: Former refugee helps hundreds of Ukrainians to safety in Alaska ANCHORAGE, Alaska (KTUU) - Hundreds of people have sought Alaska as a safe haven after war broke out in Ukraine in 2022. Catholic Social Services Alaska Office of Refugees told lawmakers last week in Juneau that Alaska has seen a drastic change in its refugee services. “In the last two years in refugee services hitting a peak of resettlement that we have never seen before,” Issa Spatrisano, the state’s refugee coordinator for CSS, said during a meeting with lawmakers. According to Spatrisano, that spike is linked to the more than 1,000 Ukrainians who came to Alaska after the war broke out overseas. Of her department’s 917 cases, that they currently handle, 619 are a part of Ukrainian humanitarian parole. A program that allows refugees to stay in Alaska for as long as two years. Refugees and their close family can reapply after the two-year mark by filling out [forms and waivers. ](https://www.uscis.gov/humanitarian/uniting-for-ukraine/re-parole-process-for-certain-ukrainian-citizens-and-their-immediate-family-members) Zori Opanasevych, a former Ukrainian refugee, came to the U.S. in the 1990s when she was seven years old. “I realized that I gotta do something,” Opanasevych said. “That’s how it helped me cope with the pain of doing something about it.” Opanasevych, who is now the program director for the Ukraine Relief Program, said she’s helped more than 1,000 Ukrainians come to Alaska in the last two years. During the early part of the year she said she would make three trips per week to the airport, welcoming about 50 Ukrainians to Alaska each time. Now, Opanasevych said she welcomes about 20 Ukrainians to Alaska each week. The need for help, she said, remains strong. “There’s people who said, ‘I’ll stay there, wait it out,’ but now they’re saying, ‘I can’t,’” Opanasevych said. ‘I just can’t handle the sirens anymore. I can’t live this way.’ Or, ‘I really lost everything at this point... I could make it through, but now I have to rely on someone else to help me get me out of here.’” Copyright 2024 KTUU. All rights reserved.

author: Aditya Dev
title: GB Nagar: Noida-YXP on road to become data centres' hub | Noida News - Times of India
text: NOIDA: Riding on major investments it has received in data centres, the UP government will offer 10 more land parcels, together measuring 50 acres, for similar projects as the roadmap for the Noida-Yamuna Expressway (YXP) region to become India's data centre hub takes shape. 106363106So far, the Hiranandani group's Yotta, the Adani Group and Microsoft have been allotted land for data centres in Noida and Greater Noida. Sify Infinite Spaces and Jackson Ltd were allocated 5 acres each in Sector 28 off the Yamuna expressway, which is fast emerging as a business hub because of the upcoming international airport in Jewar.YEIDA CEO Arun Vir Singh said that under the new scheme 10 land parcels of 5 acres each will be allotted in Sector 28. Altogether, 100 acres of land have been earmarked in the sector for developing the data centre parks and the allotments will be done through interviews based on objective parameters, he added.The state's first data centre was built last year by the Hiranandani Group on 20 acres in Greater Noida's Knowledge Park 5. Chief minister Yogi Adityanath inaugurated its first building - out of six - on October 31 last year. Two more buildings are likely to be ready next year.In Noida, MNCs like Microsoft, MAQ, and the Adani Group have acquired lands for setting up data parks. The Adani Group has been allotted two land parcels in Noida - one 8.5-acre plot in Sector 62 and another 10-acre plot in Sector 80. The company has proposed to invest over Rs 7,400 crore and create over 3,700 jobs through the two projects.Microsoft has acquired 15 acres of land in Sector 145, where the company plans to set up a software park and a data centre for Rs 1,800 crore. The units will employ more than 3,500 people. MAQ has been allotted 4 acres in Sector 145 for its IT facility.NTT Ltd, a Japanese technology firm, acquired 6 acres in Techzone 4 in 2021 and is set to start its 70 MW data centre next month. The company will invest Rs 700 crore in the project which is expected to create 300 jobs.Sudeep Gupta, the director of Artha Infratech, the development partner of NTT's data centre, said, one of the key reasons for the proliferation of data centre parks in the Noida-YXP region was an attractive policy drawn up by the UP government to provide multiple incentives to companies.\"With several companies already allotted land in the region, it has created an ecosystem. This is now attracting more companies. North India, a big market for data consumption, was in need of a data centre hub and Noida has grabbed the opportunity,\" Gupta said. Currently, Mumbai leads the way in the data centres in the country.The UP government is keen on developing a data centre ecosystem matching global standards in the state. With a target investment of Rs 20,000 crore by developing a 250 megawatt (MW) industry, it framed the data centre policy in 2021 offering various incentives in land allotment, stamp duties, and infrastructure. To cater to the energy needs of the proposed hub, the state government is also planning to set up solar energy parks.As per UP's policy, with more than 1 billion mobile and 45 million internet users, the data centre industry is expected to grow faster in India as compared to the rest of the world. Currently, about 20% of the world's total data is generated in India, while data storage capacity within the country is limited to a meagre 2%. Therefore, most of the data is stored outside the country.Demand for data protection is also growing in the country given increasing data traffic and usage as well as the confidentiality of the data. Recent estimates show India's 375MW data centre capacity is growing rapidly and is expected to add more than 750 MW capacity by the end of 2025.

organizations.name: noida news - times of india noida

author: Il Resto del Carlino
title: Stop ai rifiuti gettati a terra, arrivano 400 cestini stradali
text:
Stop ai rifiuti gettati a terra, arrivano 400 cestini stradali
Nel centro e nei quartieri a mare, si sta completando l’installazione di 400 cestini stradali di nuova concezione, progettati per disincentivarne l’uso improprio e promuovere il decoro della città balneare. La funzione di questi contenitori è quella di raccogliere residui di ridotte dimensioni come cicche di sigarette, cartacce e piccoli imballaggi, in un contesto dove purtroppo molti residenti e turisti ne fanno un uso improprio, conferendo sacchetti pieni di rifiuti che invece andrebbero smaltiti diversamente. Per contrastare questo fenomeno, oltre ad intensificare i controlli, l’amministrazione comunale, in accordo con Hera, ha deciso di procedere all’installazione di nuovi contenitori, dotati di bocche di dimensioni più ridotte e di coperchio per disincentivare l’introduzione di rifiuti grandi. Inizialmente sono stati collocati a a Valverde e Villamarina che ne erano sprovviste, da via Dante Alighieri a via Enrico Fermi, i parchi e giardini della zona di Ponente, i Giardini al Mare a Levante, e successivamente in viale Carducci, viale Dei Mille, via Bernini, via Euclide, il lungomare di Ponente, via Colombo nella zona delle colonie e alcuni nei quartieri Madonnina, Sala, Borella, Villalta e Bagnarola, inclusa la pista ciclabile del Pisciatello. Il sindaco Matteo Gozzoli e la vicesindaco Lorena Fantozzi sono soddisfatti: "Dopo avere raggiunto lo scorso anno la percentuale del 72 percento di raccolta differenziata, ci concentriamo sul decoro urbano, raccogliendo le segnalazioni dei cittadini. Inoltre facciamo una campagna per sensibilizzare contro l’abbandono dei rifiuti".
